alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Franklin; Kennebec; Lincoln; Oxford; Sagadahoc; Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 5:34PM EST until January 14 at 6:30PM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray Maine has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Kennebec County in south central Maine... Southeastern Oxford County in western Maine... Androscoggin County in southwestern Maine... Southern Somerset County in west central Maine... Lincoln County in south central Maine... Sagadahoc County in south central Maine... Southeastern Franklin County in western Maine... * Until 630 PM EST. * At 532 PM EST, an area of dangerous snow squalls was located along a line extending from 12 miles northwest of Bingham to 6 miles north of Freeport, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and trained spotter. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 32 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 74 and 142, and between mile markers 144 and 151. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Auburn, Brunswick, Augusta, Waterville, Bath, Farmington, Fairfield, Gardiner, Mechanic Falls, Damariscotta, Skowhegan, Pittsfield, Oakland, Topsham, Wiscasset, Turner, Madison, Jay, and China. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED

area.areaDesc: Androscoggin; Franklin; Kennebec; Lincoln; Oxford; Sagadahoc; Somerset
